title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is well coordinated and the team lets you know your status/next steps. It's easy to apply and they have great follow-up. It's very professional, but the team is friendly and personable. They will put you at ease.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Regional Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was very smooth and when advanced to the next interview levels it they were all scheduled very quickly. They were very transparent and honest. Everything was also done electronically.
Interview Questions: What type of leader are you?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (New Braunfels, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I conducted an interview over the phone with a senior service coordinator who was based in the headquarters location of Ohio. The interview was very casual and the interviewer was friendly. There was only one person I spoke to for the interview. The questions focused mainly on my experience with the elderly population and my knowledge of resources for low income elderly.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with seniors?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Once you have submitted an application it will be reviewed. If offered an interview they will first set up a phone interview. If you pass the phone interview you will go in for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: What was one of the most difficult things you have done in your life?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Talent Acquisition lead, and then the hiring manager. Overall, the process was very efficient and quick. They were professional, kind, and inviting. It was a great interview experience.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Sales and Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had applied for another position but was not chosen for the position. The recruiter reached out to me to interview for a sales position. I was hesitant because I did not have the type of sales experience that I thought they were looking for. The recruiter ensured me that full training would be provided. I was interviewed by two members of the sales and marketing team. I could tell that I was not a candidate when I was asked about my sales experience and when I asked about the degree of training the company provided for the position.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my customer service philosophy.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: Application online. Phone interview about 10min. Then in person interview about 20 min. Normal question and answers. Tour. Took about 30 min. They check your references. Call the next day stating your hired.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here and what do you love about working as an lpn

title: Social Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied and it took about a week for a response. I completed a short phone interview and then was asked to come in for a face to face interview. 

It took about a week and i was asked to come in for another interview. 

A few days later I was offered the job.
Interview Questions:
What are you weakness?
Previous experience

title: STNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Waverly, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was quite an experience I hadn't worked in ten years due to staying home to the enjoyment of staying home to be a mother. So I over thought the process causing the feelings being of nervous was fierce. On the day of my interview it was smooth the two ladies were exceptionally nice and made me feel comfortable. Hired on the spot!! I believe if your heart is in being an aide you'll find no better management.
Interview Questions: Something positive I expect to gain from this job experience

title: Resident Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: Typical hiring process.  I applied online, had a brief over the phone interview regarding expectations and overview of job.   I got called in for one interview, then another one.  Then I was hired.
Interview Questions: How would I handle certain resident issues

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional. The Senior Property Manager and Property Manager asked great questions and gave wonderful feedback. They were very personable and courteous through the entire process. I felt welcomed and comfortable the entire time. The overall experience was very great. I would recommend this company to others who are seeking employment in housing, social services, or healthcare. The atmosphere was calm, the staff was nice and the process was very smooth, even down to the final interview and decision.
Interview Questions:
Why do you feel that you are a good fit for this position?

What can you offer our residents?

What skills do you have that would qualify you for this position?

title: STNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Chillicothe, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process my application online and then a week later i had a call to come in for a interview i sat down with don and unit manager asked basic nursing assistant questions.
Interview Questions: What is your strongest skill?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was crazy! Had three different interviews and each person assured me I was hired, but I was nervous about three interviews in three weeks plus it was after I left my previous employment
Interview Questions: The number one question from all three interviewers was how would I deal with negative staff members

title: Activity Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Cuyahoga Falls, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with their recruiting specialist. I had to take an online personality test. I then had two interviews with their Life Enrichment Coordinator. I was told I would be notified one way or another if I was going to be offered the job. It has been over a  week and I still haven't heard anything.
Interview Questions: Describe a typical day at your present job.

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: The process took an absurd amount of time. There was months between contacts and disjointed thought process between staff and others. Finally, make it to the final interview where its narrowed down to four people and told and a personal answer would be given with two weeks. However, it was almost a month later and the answer came in the form of a letter. This a great company and the people involved in the interview process were outstanding. However the delays in notification and communication were very slow and frustrating. Although I did not receive the position, I know the company chose the best person to fit their needs. The interview questions were well developed and inquisitive.
Interview Questions: Would I live on the campus?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: Got called by one Senior Service Coordinator and then interviewed with the manager of the location, who told me I had the job and then had to back-track with the Senior RM told her she could not offer it to me without permission.  Changed compensation on me from the manager to the Senior RM's offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Property Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Huntsville, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online; received a call within a week to meet the hiring manager at the property they were hiring for.  Interview took about an hour to talk and visit the property.  Was asked to take a drug and background check and a skills/personality test.  Was offered the position.
Interview Questions: It was a general, easy-going conversation about the property and how my experience related to their needs.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief and pleasant experience. I was given a tour of the company, introduced to all the staff. I was given a brief history of the company and I was asked about myself, my nursing experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Cudahy, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from Senior Service Coordinator and Regional manager. Was informed that I would receive an email with a personality and skills test. Was sent an exam to take and completed it, A week laters received a call from property manager for an interview met with both managers for properties I was would be working after the interview I received a call the next day that I was hired.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you associated with this field of work?

title: Property Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at National Church Residences
Interview Descriptions: Found the position on Craigslist.  Contact was made within the week, which turned into a brief phone interview.  Formal interview was scheduled within a week of the call.  Interview was very casual, yet engaging.  I didn't feel as though I was getting the third degree.  Conversation was based on the position, what the position entails, how I was qualified and a glimpse into a day in the life.
Interview Questions: I don't recall a most difficult question because the interview really just flowed like a conversation, however, still stayed on topic.

title: Front Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Short and simple, basic questions asked! Got sense interviewer wasn't qualified for their job! Easiest interview I've had in 38 years of working! As soon as interview was over, job was offered.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Atlanta, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic phone interview. I had an interview with who became my Supervisor first then his supervisor. The interview kept me at ease and was pretty friendly throughout. There were non of those questions that tend to trip me up.
Interview Questions: Standard question. I believe one of the questions that stood out was a difficult situation I had and how I handled it.

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Ballston Spa, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: At the first interview I met with the property manager, he was very nice and straightforward. I was given material to take an online test, that consisted of IQ, personality, education and computer skills after completing it I met with the PM again and the RM by phone. The interview lasted about 1/2 hour and I was told they would call within the week. Later that day the PM call and I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Education, Background that would qualify me over other candidates. why I wanted to work at this location.

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National Church Residences (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line just by sending a resume. I never completed an application. I had a telephone interview and then and online computer assessment. The assessment, which I did pass, consisted of 35 questions. Many of them were about the parts of a computer and storage media devices which I thought was strange because it was suppose to be an assessment of Word, Outlook and Excel.  I was then sent to their clients, two property managers that had no clue as how to conduct an interview. The candidates were not fairly vetted.
Interview Questions: All the questions from beginning to end end were standard: Tell me about yourself. What are you a good fit for the position, What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Maintenance Tech I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Spokane, WA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
3 round face to face interviews taking up all sorts of time they are paranoid about their workers so they will ask you background questions galore.
the job is so easy painting and cleaning a 10 year old can do it. So they dont even worry about that part.
Interview Questions: Have you ever stolen money for an elder or placed their life in jeopardy by messing with their drugs.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Upper Arlington, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: When I first walked in I was not impressed by the professionalism. The staff was dressed informal all three office visits I had and the office furniture was shabby in the waiting areas. The interviews were easy with standard interview questions. The interviewers were very friendly and enthusiastic. They had been very persistent with follow-up calls and emails which seemed like a good sign. However, after a 4th interview the head of HR told me a date they would be making the decision and that I would be informed either way. I was never contacted and my follow-up attempts were continuously ignored. After a 4th interview I would expect at least a rejection email or some common courtesy after going through 1 phone interview and 3 office interviews.
Interview Questions: Standard Questions

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at National Church Residences (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: After responding to ad or post for employment , expect a delay in response so patience is required, keep sending your interest.  Initial phone interview telling a bit about yourself and your past experience and why you are interested in the position.  Pretty standard and relaxed phone conversation depending on the manager.  Computer literacy test will be the next step and is pretty standard and basic knowledge of word, excel, etc.  Interview at individual site where the position is and with the director of that location.  Mine was relaxed and informative and not at all like a "normal" interview.  Expect a wait after this interview again dependant on the NCR management, mine took about 3 weeks to hear the results and be offered a position.  If offered a position another wait while mandatory drug test is recieved and results reported.  From interview to hire notice about a month and half.  Add another month from interest in position and inital sending of your resume. Long process but worth it if hired.  There will be a half day training and mine was totally irrelevant to my site.  Dress for interview at site should be informal business.
Interview Questions: None, all expected or standard why do you want to work for National Church and what are your strongest assets you would bring to the job.
